title: Polish judging flow: Home quote, Circles entry, safer Start Chat, and seeded Global Chat

requirements.summary: Add a bottom-of-Home motivational quote section after the existing “Your Journey Continues” section without impacting layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page displays a motivational quote section at the bottom of the page.
The quote text is English and does not overlap or break the existing Home page sections on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Add a new, responsive motivational quote section (English) immediately after the existing “Your Journey Continues” card, ensuring spacing and typography match current layout and do not affect other sections.

requirements.summary: Make each circle’s primary action navigate into an in-app circle detail view that shows circle info and supports returning to the circles list, without backend changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "View Circle" for a listed circle takes the user to a circle view screen within the app.
The circle view screen shows the circle name/topic and provides an obvious way to return to the Circles list.
No runtime errors occur when entering a circle.

file_operations.description: Create a shared mock circles data module (ids, name, topic, members/maxMembers) that can be reused by the Circles list and the circle detail screen (frontend-only; no backend dependency).
Replace the no-op “View Circle” button behavior to navigate to an in-app circle detail route (e.g., /circles/$circleId) using the circle id from the shared mock circles module.

Implement a circle detail screen that reads the circle id from the route params, looks up the circle in the shared mock circles data, displays circle name/topic (and optional member counts), and provides an obvious back action to return to /circles. Handle unknown ids gracefully with an English message and a back link.
Register and wire a new protected route for the circle detail screen (e.g., /circles/$circleId) so it is reachable via UI navigation from the Circles page.

requirements.summary: Prevent runtime crashes when starting a chat from Connections by safely handling invalid/placeholder partner identifiers and ensuring ChatPage never throws on invalid Principal parsing.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Start Chat" on the Connections page does not crash the app or show an uncaught error in the UI/console.

If a partner identifier cannot be parsed into a Principal, the app shows a user-friendly message and routes to a safe screen state (e.g., Chat page with "No Chat Selected" state or similar) without throwing.
When a valid partner Principal is present in the URL, ChatPage continues to load conversation messages as before.

file_operations.description: Guard Principal parsing by wrapping Principal.fromText in a try/catch and treating invalid partner values as null; render a safe, user-friendly state (English) instead of throwing, and avoid calling conversation queries with invalid partner values.

Harden the “Start Chat” navigation so it does not pass placeholder/invalid partner identifiers that can crash ChatPage. If the connection id is not a valid Principal text, navigate to /chat without a partner (safe state) and show an English, user-friendly notification in-page (or via an existing banner mechanism) explaining that the chat cannot be opened yet.

requirements.summary: Seed Global Chat with realistic initial messages for empty/fresh states and remove “be the first” empty-state wording; keep all user-facing text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh state where no global chat messages exist, the Global Chat feed displays a non-empty list of seeded messages.
The Global Chat page no longer displays the empty-state text "No messages yet. Be the first to share!" and does not include similar "you are the first" wording anywhere in the Global Chat UI.
Seeded messages look like realistic short thoughts/experiences and include perspectives that match the existing perspective options.

file_operations.description: Create a frontend-only seed dataset of realistic short global chat messages, each tagged with one of the existing Global Chat perspectives; include multiple entries across perspectives for a non-empty initial feed.

Update Global Chat feed rendering to display seeded messages when the backend feed returns empty (fresh/empty state). Remove/replace the current empty-state copy containing “Be the first to share!” with neutral English copy, ensuring no “you are the first” phrasing appears anywhere in the Global Chat UI.
